3 The existence of more than one recent species of the same
type was indicated or explicitly mentioned by several of the
foregoing writers. Thus Fortis tells us (op. cit), on the authority
of a voyager in the Indian Seas, that living Discolites have
been found there; and as there are no existing Nummulites, this
statement probably refers to an Orbitolites.
Lamarck, in his second edition, describes under the title of
<u>O. marginalis</u>, a small form of Orbitolites only 2 millim (-08 inch) in
diameter, found upon fuci, corallines, &c in the European Seas; this
he speaks of as the only living example of the genus then known;
and he defines it as <u>O. utrinque plana</u>, <u>margine poroso</u>. Besides
this species, however, Defrance (op. cit) mentions another more
closely resembling the <u>O<s>rbitolites</s> complanata</u> of the Paris basin as existing on the shores of New Holland; and this seems the first
